page.title: 09New Mills Pottery
page.content:
Mr. Davidson came to New Mills in 1964 to start the pottery. He{used to live {in London}but he thinks it is better living in Cornwall because it has a good climate and it is quiet and peaceful.
He makes mostly{stoneware pots}for cooking but he also makes{porcelain. He has a metal wheel with an electric motor; it takes about{20 minutes to {throw 10 pots}on the wheel. After throwing he puts on handles and lids. Then he bakes the pots in a small {kiln,}which he{made himself,}to fire them. He sells his pottery in his{own shop in New Mills and in a shop called the {'Guild of Ten' in Truro}that he owns a share of. He also sells to{other shops {in Cornwall}as well as to some in {London.
